channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Quarantine strands 3.5 million Pinoy adults in July — SWS
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: About 3.5 million adult Filipinos were stranded last month due to community quarantines, according to a recent mobile phone survey conducted by the Social Weather Stations.

item.title: ‘Philippines likely to become Southeast Asia’s COVID-19 hot spot’
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Amid rising numbers of COVID-19 cases in the country, the Philippines is likely to become Southeast Asia’s coronavirus hot spot, according to The Straits Times of Singapore.

item.title: 2 broadcast firms get 25-year franchise extension
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte has signed laws granting a 25-year extension to the franchises of two broadcasting firms weeks after a House panel denied ABS-CBN a franchise.

item.title: Doctors call for ‘demilitarized medical quarantine’ vs COVID-19
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: A group of doctors has called for reforms in the country’s response to COVID-19, saying there is a need for “demilitarized medical quarantine.”

item.title: MECQ effect on COVID-19 spread known in 2 weeks
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Although the government is sure of the adverse impact of the modified enhanced community quarantine on the economy, it might take another week or two before the government can assess the impact of the stricter quarantine on public health, a Malacañang official said yesterday.

item.title: Meralco meter reading to continue in MECQ areas
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: Manila Electric Co. has assured its customers that business operations, including meter reading activities, would continue in areas placed under modified enhanced community quarantine

item.title: Go Negosyo, Makati launch pooled swab testing
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Private sector mass testing initiative Project Antibody Rapid test Kit has joined forces with Makati City for the pilot implementation of the pooled swab testing for COVID-19.

item.title: OFWs recount horror
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Ursula Guira, a Filipina domestic helper injured in the explosion Tuesday in Beirut, narrated her ordeal with blood still dripping from her face after the blast.

item.title: ARTA: Automatic approval for telco towers after 7 days
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Anti-Red Tape Authority is declaring the automatic approval of applications for building telecommunications towers with complete requirements and paid fees pending for more than seven days with local government units or national government agencies.

item.title: 2 Pinoys dead, 8 hurt in Beirut
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Two Filipina household service workers were killed, eight others were injured while two Filipinos were reported missing after a massive explosion hit Beirut, Lebanon on Tuesday, the Department of Foreign Affairs said.
